questions.context: Direction: Read the e-mail below.FROM: EZ Travel, Inc.TO: Karl IonescoSUBJECT: Feedback follow-upSENT: July 20, 1:16 P.M.Dear Mr. Ionesco,A few days ago, you completed our survey and indicated dissatisfaction with our flight- and hotel-booking services. Please provide details about the problems you experienced so that we can improve our travel services.Thank you.KarinEZ Travel, Inc.Directions: Respond to the e-mail. In your e-mail, give THREE details.

questions.context: Direction: Read the e-mail below.FROM: Daniel ZimmermanTO: Susan KahnSUBJECT: WorkshopsSENT: January 18, 3:47 P.M.Dear Ms. Kahn,A friend recommended your workshops. I think my colleagues could benefit from more professional development opportunities. Could you tell me about the various workshops you offer?Thanks,DanielDirections: Respond to the e-mail. In your e-mail, give TWO pieces of information and ask ONE question.

questions.context: Some people believe that it is better to work on a team with the same coworkers for a long period of time. Others believe it is better to regularly change work teams. Which do you agree with? Why?Give reasons and examples to support your opinion.
